question: What is the Crew Youth Collaborative?
answer: The Crew Youth Collaborative is a coalition of organizations mobilizing college-age youth to take action for a thriving world in their communities and on the Crew Platform. You can read more about what the collaborative is and about the grant organization, Enlight, here.

question: What is Catalyst 2018?
answer: Catalyst 2018 is a gathering of representatives of organizations that make up the Crew Youth Collaborative interested in learning how to level up their leadership and catalyze their communities! It is the first experience of it's kind where different organizations are joining forces, when in the past they may have hosted their own separate leadership conferences, but are now uniting in the spirit of radical collaboration.

question: Why should I attend Catalyst 2018?
answer: You should attend Catalyst 2018 because this is your LIFE and a 3.5-day retreat to deepen your understanding of self, what you want in life, what you are capable of, and how to cause the change you want to see in the world through your community action is a great way to spend a weekend this summer!

question: Where will the Catalyst 2018 retreat be hosted?
answer: Catalyst 2018 will be hosted in Bryn Athyn, PA at Bryn Athyn College.

question: When is the Catalyst 2018 retreat?
answer: Catalyst 2018 begins at approximately 4pm ET on Friday, August 3 and ends at about 12pm ET on Monday, August 6, 2018.

question: Who will be at Catalyst 2018?
answer: Representatives from Crew organizations from across the country, including students, staff, and alumni, as well as special guest speakers.

question: How many people should my school send?
answer: We encourage your school to send at least one representative AND you are invited to send more--check with your organization's staff to see if they have any specific limits. Most likely, we will be able to make it possible to host whoever wants to be there!

question: How much is registration?
answer: Registration is $200 per attendee, but check with your organization's leadership to see if they have scholarships available.

question: What is your refund/cancellation policy?
answer: Registration is fully refundable up until the registration close date of July 20. After July 20, your organization will be responsible for covering the full cost of your attendance, whether you attend or not, so best check with your organization to see what their cancellation policy is. Some organizations have a non-refundable deposit. In addition, you may be liable to reimburse any travel funding you may have received in the event of a cancellation.

question: How do I travel to Catalyst 2018?
answer: If driving, meet us at Bryn Athyn College. There is ample free parking available on campus. Parking lots are in front of the Brickman Center, along the side of the Brickman Center and Pendleton Hall, in a small lot adjacent to the Doering Center, along certain campus roadways, and in a lot next to the Bryn Athyn College Experiential Learning Garden.
answer-2: If taking a train, bus, or airplane to Philadelphia, we will be coordinating Lyft rides for you from the train/bus station or airport. We just need you to submit your travel itinerary by July 20, and then someone from our logistics team will follow up with you.
answer-3: If you have any questions, please email support@catalyst2018.org.

question: At what time should I book my travel in and out of the greater Bryn Athyn area?
answer: If driving, please plan to arrive at Bryn Athyn College (BAC) between 3:00pm – 4:00pm on Friday August 3rd and plan on leaving after noon on Monday August 6th.
answer-2: If taking a train, bus, or flying, your goal is to arrive at the airport or train/bus station in Philadelphia by around 2pm on Friday, August 3rd and departure after 4pm on Monday, August 6th, to ensure you have ample time to get to/from the airport/station.

question: Is it okay to drive to Catalyst 2018?
answer: Yes - in fact, we encourage carpooling! Plan on arriving at Bryn Athyn College between 3 - 4:00 pm on Friday, August 3rd and departing on Monday, August 6th around noon. You can park your car on campus for free during the duration of your stay.

question: Is there funding available to pay for travel to and from Catalyst 2018?
answer: This will be different for each organization, so we encourage you to follow up with your organization's staff!

question: What is the weather like in Bryn Athyn?
answer: Come ready for 64-90 degrees. Climate is warm and humid!

question: What do I need to bring?
answer: You will need to bring your own pillow, sleeping bag (or bedding), and towel - no linens will be provided. We will be sending out a packing list four weeks prior to the event with more details.

question: What is the dress code?
answer: We want to make sure that you are comfortable. Be ready for anything from sitting to playing interactive games. We will be spending time both inside and outside, and sometimes the air-conditioning (which is a privilege to have) is out of our control and the indoor spaces are cold while it's very hot outside.

question: What will be provided at the Catlyst 2018 retreat?
answer: Once you arrive at Bryn Athyn College, you have nothing to worry about, as long as you've brought everything on your packing list. Meals and lodging are covered in your registration fee. We will also provide you with any needed training materials.

question: Do I have to stay at Bryn Athyn for the duration of the retreat? Or can I arrive late or leave early?
answer: In short, yes. We believe it’s important to stay on-site to be fully immersed and present for the time we have together. Besides, you won't want to miss anything! If you are really committed to being at Catalyst 2018 but have special circumstances that make it hard for you to be there for the duration of the retreat, please reach out to your organization's staff to discuss.

question: What will the accomodations be like?
answer: Everyone attending Catalyst 2018 will be staying in suites that each sleep 5 people. A suite consists of 2 double rooms and a single room with a shared kitchen and living space. You will find out who you are staying with when you arrive. We do our best to place people from the same organizations together- however, you may also be given the opportunity to stay with members of other organizations. If you have any concerns about lodging please do not hesitate to contact your staff contact or email support@catalyst2018.org. We want to make sure that you feel safe and are comfortable with lodging. We will do our very best to address any special needs or concerns.

question: What is the schedule like?
answer: A full draft of the Catalyst 2018 schedule will be made available as the summer approaches.

question: Will we have a chance to see nearby sights?
answer: In short, no, not between the start and end of the Catalyst. We are together only for 3.5 days and we have a lot to cover; If you’d like to tour around, plan on arriving a few days earlier or staying later. Please know that we are only providing transportation to and from transit hubs at particular times on August 3rd and August 6th.

question: Will I have cell service or internet access?
answer: Yes, you will. We invite you to use it during free time, but don’t forget: we’re only together in person for 3.5 days, and it’s important to be present!

question: Can I bring outside food to the retreat?
answer: Yes, you can. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner will be provided throughout the event, but if you would like to bring your own food and snacks you can store them in your suite’s kitchen. If you have special dietary considerations that require access to food outside of scheduled meal times, we would love to collaborate with you to ensure your needs are met, so please email support@catalyst2018.org and we will connect with you!

question: If I am the only one representing my organization/school/chapter, will I feel out of place?
answer: If you are the only one representing your organization, school, or chapter, fear not--you will not be the only one who is the only one representing their org! Rest assured that you will not feel alone, as the majority of folks arriving at this event will hardly know anyone, and we intentionally create time and opportunities for getting to know folks and building community right from the get-go, so that by the end of the weekend you will be surprised to find that you now have all of these new friends who you feel like you've known your entire life! But if you have any concerns or trepidations about this, please let us know, so we can figure out how to make you feel comfortable and welcomed!
